title: Motsi Mabuse reveals she ‘never sees’ Oti since joining Strictly
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Motsi Mabuse might be working on the same show as her sister, Oti Mabuse, but the newest judge on Strictly Come Dancing reveals they don’t get much of a chance to hang out.

Oti, who’s dancing with Kelvin Fletcher on this year’s series, have consistently been in the top three of the leaderboard, but all that hard work means they don’t have much time off.

Motsi told Metro.co.uk on the red carpet at the Pride Of Britain Awards that their busy schedules on the show means she and Oti hardly see each other during filming.

She explained: ‘Do you know, the honest truth is I never see her. I absolutely never see my sister.

‘So we’re in one room but that’s it, and I see her on the dancefloor and then maybe I see her at the after party.’

Despite having to judge her sister and her celebrity partner in the competition, Motsi doesn’t feel like she has to be extra harsh on them to avoid being accused of favouritism.

Despite working on the same show, Motsi admits she never sees Oti while filming (Picture: Getty)

Motsi admitted: ‘No, Oti’s a tough girl, I don’t have to be extra hard. She knows what she wants, she’s ambitious, she’s a clever girl, she’s brilliant and she knows when it’s her time, so I can be honest and that’s the most important thing. She’s amazing.’

She also revealed why she appeared to be ‘livid’ at the result of last weekend’s show, when Mike Bushell was saved over Catherine Tyldesley.

Motsi explained: ‘Well, I was sad, I was sad because I see Johannes [Radebe], he’s a young man from South Africa, I see what he’s achieved, I loved what he did last week.

‘I see those two, they’re so close together and just seeing their sadness, it comes to you and you just let it out.’
